newsitem.title: UK: Currency/data supports quiet Euro veg oil market.
newsitem.headline: Currency/data supports quiet Euro veg oil market.

text.p: Tumbling Asian currencies and data from PORLA and the USDA supported prices on a holiday hit European vegetable oil market on Friday.

New lows against the dollar by the Malaysian ringgit and Indonesian rupiah coupled with friendly data from the Malaysian Palm Oil Registration and Licensing Authority (PORLA) supported palm oil prices.
But the full impact is not likely to hit prices in Europe until Monday owing to the Assumption Day holiday in many European countries.
PORLA pegged Malaysian palm oil output at 833,159 tonnes during July against 791,426 in June, a rise of 5.27 percent.
Exports were 715,906 tonnes against 622,210 tonnes in June, while stocks fell from 789,806 tonnes at end-June to 769,275 tonnes at end-July, a fall of 2.6 percent.
The Malaysian Oil Palm Growers' Council released data before PORLA and put output at 828,000 tonnes in July, 5.1 percent from June.
In its estimate for the first 15 days of August cargo surveyor SGS put local palm oil exports at 312,757 tonnes against 307,536 during the same period in June.
"To say today's figures have been friendly is an understatement, but a lot of the increases we have seen this morning are due to currency," said one trader.
The lauric oil sector took its lead from palm oil despite the good supply situation.
In the soft oil sector firm Chicago soy oil futures on the back of good export numbers from the USDA underpinned the market, but buyers were showing little interest.

"People start to be tried of Chicago at this time of year and as far as most people are concern the weather market has been relegated to side-show status until the harvest, but these export figures have made some people sit-up and take notice," said one trader.
On Thursday the USDA said U.S. net export sales of soyoil during the week ended August 7 total 30,800 tonnes, against trade expectations of 5,000 to 10,000 tonnes.
At midday Dutch soy oil was one to two guilders up while rape oil was 1.25 to two guilders higher.
Palm oil was $2.50 higher across the board with no further business reported since the opening.
Coconut oil sellers were $5 to $10 up while palmkernel oil was $2.50 higher.
